sentences.sContent: She began to harp us to drink after dinner.
sentences.sContent_eng: She began to harp us to drink after dinner.
sentences.sCn: 用餐后，她开始弹奏起竖琴让我们饮酒消食。

sentences.sContent: She swept her fingers over the strings of the harp.
sentences.sContent_eng: She swept her fingers over the strings of the harp.
sentences.sCn: 她用手指划过竖琴的琴弦。

sentences.sContent: I never learned how to tune a harp, or play upon a lute; but I know how to raise a small and obscure city to glory and greatness...where to all kindreds of the earth will pilgrim.
sentences.sContent_eng: I never learned how to tune a harp, or play upon a lute; but I know how to raise a small and obscure city to glory and greatness...where to all kindreds of the earth will pilgrim.
sentences.sCn: 我从未学习过如何为竖琴调弦，也不知如何弹奏鲁特琴。 但我懂得如何使一座偏僻的无名小镇发展成辉煌而伟大的城市，使世界各国的子民前来朝圣。

synos.tran: 弹奏竖琴；喋喋不休；不停地说

trans.tranCn: 弹奏竖琴；喋喋不休；不停地说

trans.tranOther: a large musical instrument with strings that are stretched across a vertical frame with three corners, and that you play with your fingers
